bug.author: nojvek
bug.summary: classify_image.py file not found at tensorflow/models/image/imagenet
bug.description: It seems the tutorials are out of date.

comments.comment:
I believe this is fixed; the directory is now listed on this page: <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/image_recognition>https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/image_recognition</denchmark-link>
references this repo: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/models>https://github.com/tensorflow/models</denchmark-link>
and asks you to find classify_image.py: cd models/tutorials/image/imagenet which lines up with this: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/tutorials/image/imagenet>https://github.com/tensorflow/models/tree/master/tutorials/image/imagenet</denchmark-link>
Please reopen or refile if this is in error. Thanks!

I work in windows, python, tensorflow clone models from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/models>https://github.com/tensorflow/models</denchmark-link>
and I found classify_image.py in \ models-master \ tutorials \ image \ imagenet directory
